actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-787, by Ms. Slaughter.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3603 with 1 hour and 30 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 2(l)(3)(A) of rule XI or clause 8 of rule XXI are waived. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. The text of H.R. 5600, as modified by the amendments printed in the report of the Rules Committee shall be considered as original text. Points of order for failure to comply with clause 7 rule XVI are waived.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 191.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 247 - 166 (Roll no. 369).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 196 (Roll No. 370).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3603) to promote family preservation and the prevention of foster care with emphasis on families where abuse of alcohol or drugs is present, and to improve the quality and delivery of child welfare, foster care, and adoption services.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 3603 (family preservation and foster care prevention).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3603) to promote family preservation and the prevention of foster care with emphasis on families where abuse of alcohol or drugs is present, and to improve the quality and delivery of child welfare, foster care, and adoption services.
